references.paper_title: On the dangers of stochastic parrots: Can language models be too big?
references.reason: This paper is foundational in raising crucial ethical concerns regarding the size and potential biases of large language models, directly relevant to the responsible development of LLM-based systems.

references.paper_title: Summaries, highlights, and action items: Design, implementation and evaluation of an LLM-powered meeting recap system
references.reason: This work directly addresses LLM applications in meeting summarization, a closely related task that shares significant technical and conceptual overlap with the current research on LLM-powered meeting delegates.

references.paper_title: Multi-user chat assistant (MUCA): A framework using LLMs to facilitate group conversations
references.reason: This paper explores LLMs in the role of facilitators in group discussions, offering valuable insights into managing complex conversational dynamics, a key aspect of the challenges in building LLM-powered meeting delegates.

references.paper_title: Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback
references.reason: This paper is highly influential in showcasing the effectiveness of reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) in aligning LLMs with human intentions, directly impacting the methodology of developing and evaluating LLMs for meeting participation.

references.paper_title: MeetingQA: Extractive question-answering on meeting transcripts
references.reason: This research focuses on question-answering tasks using meeting transcripts, providing a benchmark dataset and insights into handling real-world meeting data, crucial for developing robust LLM-based meeting delegate systems.
